subject: Back at the Holdfast
event: Returned home last night from my short visit to LA, where I attended a private screening of the first two episodes of GAME OF THRONES, made a surprise visit to the food truck in Venice, enjoyed a great celebratory dinner with Dan and David at the Palm (where we first met, lo these many years ago), called on Justin Sweet in his Yorba Linda studio and saw some gorgeous roughs of the artwork he'll be doing for the forthcoming WORLD OF ICE & FIRE concordance, met with Mark Newbauer of Mike the Pike Productions about their on-going SKIN TRADE film project, and even enjoyed a great lunch with old friend Ron Perlman, from my days on BEAUTY AND THE BEAST. It was an amazing few days, if insanely busy. The first two episodes look spectacular, I think, especially when seen on the big screen at CAA. Cinematic quality. (I have a new 55 inch TV set being installed this week, and now I'm afraid that it's too small) These were the first complete episodes I've seen, and I loved them. Yes, there are changes from the books, and of course there are things missing -- lines of dialogue, bits of business, scenes -- but without twice or thrice the running time, there was no way to get EVERYTHING in. The story is there, that's the important thing. Fans who know the books inside and out may miss certain things, sure, but the vast majority of viewers, those who have never read the novels, should do just fine. My hat is off to David and Dan and the team they put together. They've done an amazing job. Oh, and HBO has released a new trailer. Herewith, "Poison."

comments.article:
Did you talk about Sons Of Anarchy with Ron? Man, I love that show, hehe. I'm assuming since he's an old buddy you watch it?

glad you had a great weekend!

One week George, one week. you know we're (your fans) all chomping at the bit. We're confident it's going to be a BIG hit. I'm so ready. Can't wait!
comments.subject: Ron

comments.article:
Fuck yeah! Lysa Arryn!

*shivers*
We just got a 55" HDTV, and are having a Game Of Thrones party for our nearest and dearest for the premier. The sneak preview looked gorgeous on it and I can't wait to see more. Enjoy the new screen!

I can't tell if you honestly think they did a good job, or if you just kind of have to say that. Having experience with these kinds of adaptations, the author almost always says it is good, even if it's not.

It must be really tough to give up your baby like this, on the other hand, it must be a relief to let someone else be responsible if things go wrong :) Thanks for giving D+D the chance to make this series though! Looking forward to it.
I'm suddenly reminded of Ursula Le Guin, who has suffered through several adaptations of her work that she's hated, and isn't afraid to describe her loathing at length.

It looks fantastic.  No cable for me, but I've already put it on Netflix queue for when it is released to DVD.  In the mean time, I'm enjoying a re-read of all the books in the series.  Congratulations on your success!

Mr. Martin, just wanted to stop by and say thank you, for you changed my life with your books, and my brothers are equally loving them, we can't wait for HBO's adaptation, Croatia is ready (come visit us in Zagreb one day, second time that is)!

comments.upictitle: ♔ Lydzi ♔ Au service du Roi Rickon.: Sunny Baudelaire
comments.article:
I get shivers everytime I look at that picture of the Wall :o. I had the same feeling when I first read about it (well since I just began the books a couple of weeks ago, the feeling is still fresh :p).

It's so ... gigantic.

Can't wait for the premiere. Counting the days XD!

comments.upictitle: Canary In A Coal Mine: WoD - Just Frenzy
comments.article:
I know it's not quite as cool (or possibly as weird) as when folks name their kids after your characters, but I have my own Balerion (2.0, feline version) and we will be watching GoT together this weekend, we can't wait!

Pic of my Balerion!

Edited to change pic to a link.
I can't wait. I'm annoying all my friends, going on about in incessantly.
Wait...are they combining events from Clash of Kings into the first Season of Game of Thrones?...I thought C. Stark didn't talk to L. Aryn in person until CoK?
comments.subject: GoT and CoK

comments.article: No, 'Clash of Kings' will have a series all of its own if a second season is commissioned.  There are supposed to be a few bits and pieces used in the first season for various reasons though.
comments.subject: Re: GoT and CoK

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: cocktail
comments.article:
I'm pleased that you got a chance to taste some of the food that Colicchio and crew developed. Every time I went to the truck in NYC, I had a little voice in my head saying "I wish George were here to enjoy this." Mr. X and I would have brought a hip-flask of Fire&Blood cocktails, and we could have made a thoroughly illegal party of it. ;-)

And on that note, we already have a tentative recipe for this year's cocktail. It needs some work, but we will bear the burden with pride...and aspirin.

Can't wait for the series and can't wait for your next book. You rock and this series is amazing. You are marking your place in history with this one, friend.

One little thing. As a geographer I am fascinated with the intricate world you have created and associated maps. Any plans to create something more detailed than what is in the books? I am a map checker and am always a bit disappointed when you reference places that I cannot find on the map.
comments.subject: Love it

comments.article:
"No, I already ate....why, what are you having for dinner?"

"Stallion's heart".
comments.subject: "hungry?"

comments.article: Alas that I don't have access to HBO! Instead I console myself with re-reading the books. ;)

Nice to see one of my favorites in there, just like I pictured him. Great preview, gives people that don't know the series a little more to chew on. The last line's a little oddly placed as a closer, but w/e.

How many episodes are "completed" at this time?
comments.subject: Varys

comments.article: I have heard reports that most US cable/dish providers will be having a free HBO weekend for the premiere.
comments.subject: Free HBO weekend for the premiere

comments.article:
I think you are one of the few authors who got considerable say over a TV series or movie based on an authors books. Anyway you could make some blog entries about how you participated? How much say you got in what was changed in the TV series and what it is like working on a TV series? How much say did you get in casting? Do you think that part of the reason why you were trusted with a role was due to your prior experience as a TV writer?

You responded to one of my posts last year about how you had the luxury of holding out for a director who would allow you to have input. I think it would be very interesting to your fans if you talked more about how this works in some blog entries.
comments.subject: please blog more about your work on the tv show

comments.article: I thought Lysa was fat?

I ordered HBO and have it scheduled it to be installed on Saturday... Woot! I just need to install two more speakers for 5.1 audio... which I've neglected to get around to for about a year now. I've also purposefully not re-read the book because I don't want to get caught up in book vs. movie while I'm watching. It'll still happen some I'm sure, I haven't completely forgotten the book, but I'm hoping it'll be more like, "Ah, I remember that from the book" type of experience.

Anyway, can't wait to see this finally come to life... I tell people that my favorite book series ever is coming to HBO, and now they're interested. I really can't wait to see Tyrion, I know Dinklage will play the part well, and that's going to be awesome. Well, I'm sure all the actors are awesome, but Tyrion is my favorite from the books.
comments.subject: Almost ready

comments.article: Had Comcast in to install cable on Saturday.  The first (and so far only) channel we checked was HBO and just in time to see a Game of Thrones featurette.
Ohhh yeah, it's happening! Brazil is eagerly awating!

http://www.freepreview.tv/

I don't know how offical this is.

I am curious about whether there will be an option to see the series on HBO website or the like in some kind of pay per view arrangement? Locally I don't have a subscription to HBO because it comes in a package with dozens of other programs that I have no interest in. I'd probably get it just to see Game of Thrones, but I am interested if there are other options.

Anyone knows?
comments.subject: Payment options

comments.article:
I looked for something else besides having to order cable and HBO, but I couldn't find anything. HBO has the "HBO Go" which you can view HBO content on... but that requires one to have an HBO subscription as well. The only thing you can hope for as a potential alternative, is if HBO changes its Go model and makes it available to non-subscribers on a pay-per-view basis or some type of Go subscription.

Another thing is that HBO comes with more than one HBO channel, if that's what you were indicating by "dozens of other channels." I think my cable HBO package has like 7 or 8 HBO channels, and I know the satellite HBO packages were similar. If you're talking about other non-HBO channels, you might try calling your provider directly because they usually try to be accommodating to make their customers happy. They're also able to give discounts that aren't advertised... my story:

I ordered cable online with a install date of this coming Saturday, I got an email yesterday saying they would install next Wednesday, I called them, let them know I was upset about it, they said they could get it installed the next day (today) but otherwise it would be on the 20th, I told them I wanted to cancel to see if I could get satellite on Saturday, while waiting for a fee to get reimbursed the guy decided to give me a discount on my current internet plan (to keep me as a customer) and improved the data rate of the internet plan, he then offered a discounted digital package and free Showtime to go along with the HBO. I wanted my install on Saturday because I simply didn't want to take off work to get cable installed... but by calling them and maybe being a little upset, I'm now getting an upgraded internet, more channels and Showtime for less money than I was about to pay when ordering online. So, if I were you, I'd definitely call to get set up and maybe find something to be upset about the price or options offered before calling.
comments.subject: Re: Payment options

comments.article: Hi, I watched the preview of the 1st episode the other day, and I've been disappointed by the fact that there is no smoke coming out from people mouths at the wall. That'd have been nice to see smoke coming out from the living (horses, humans), and not from the white walker for example. Else the preview was great. I'm looking forward the DVD release! (can't see HBO in Japan, or don't know how to)
comments.subject: Need water vapor at the wall
